review.title: Fuzzy soft rough K-Means clustering approach for gene expression data
review.abstract: Clustering is one of the widely used data mining techniques for medical diagnosis. Clustering can be considered as the most important unsupervised learning technique. Most of the clustering methods group data based on distance and few methods cluster data based on similarity. The clustering algorithms classify gene expression data into clusters and the functionally related genes are grouped together in an efficient manner. The groupings are constructed such that the degree of relationship is strong among members of the same cluster and weak among members of different clusters. In this work, we focus on a similarity relationship among genes with similar expression patterns so that a consequential and simple analytical decision can be made from the proposed Fuzzy Soft Rough K-Means algorithm. The algorithm is developed based on Fuzzy Soft sets and Rough sets. Comparative analysis of the proposed work is made with bench mark algorithms like K-Means and Rough K-Means and efficiency of the proposed algorithm is illustrated in this work by using various cluster validity measures such as DB index and Xie-Beni index.

metadata.title: FUZZY SOFT ROUGH K-MEANS CLUSTERING APPROACH FOR GENE EXPRESSION DATA

sections.text: Index Terms - Entropieranking, Fuzzy Soft Rough K-Means, Gene Based Clustering, K-Means, Microarray Data, Rough K-Means, Soft Set Similarity Approach. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

sections.heading: 1 INTRODUCTION
sections.text: It is not the first time that the EU Commission has taken such a step.

sections.heading: 1.1 Gene expression data
sections.text: The genes are responsible for the growth of cells and keep them healthy. Normally, each cell is divided in two - with control of the gene. From the two cells, healthy new cells take over and old ones die out. Thus, the expression of a gene provides a measure of the activity of a gene under certain biochemical conditions. It is known that certain diseases, such as cancer, are reflected in the change in the expression values of certain genes. In a cancer cell, mutations can "turn on" and "turn off" others in a cell. Gene expression represents the activation level of each gene within an organism at a certain time. The expression value provides the activity of a gene under certain biochemical conditions (including samples). Gene expression data from a microarray experiment can be represented by a real-value expression matrix M =, as shown in Figure 1, where the lines (G = expression patterns of genes that represent columns (S = expression patterns of genes representing period profiles of samples).

sections.heading: 1.2 Fuzzy Soft Set Theory: A Review
sections.text: Most of the definitions presented in this section can be found in [10] [13] [14]. Soft set theory as a new mathematical tool for dealing with uncertainties that traditional mathematical tools cannot handle [11]. Definition 1. Let U be an initial universe set and E be a set of parameters. Let P (U) count the power set of U and a pair of A (F, A) as a soft set over U, where F is a figure given by F: A → P (U). In other words, a soft set over U is a parameterized family of subsets of universe U.

sections.heading: 1.3 Fuzzy soft set similarity
sections.text: In this paper, we are often interested in whether two patterns are identical or nearly identical, or at least to what extent identical. Researchers have investigated the problem of similarity measurement between groups; the set may consist of blurred numbers and vague quantities [10]. P. Majumdar, S. K. Samanta introduced the concept of similarity measurement of the soft set. Let U = {x1, x2,... xn} be the universal set of elements and E = {e1, e2,..., em} be the universal set of parameters. Let and are two families of blurred soft sets. Now the similarity between and is found and it is denoted by S (Here, the similarity technique based on the soft set is used to calculate the similarity of genes. Only maximum similarity genes are placed in the same clusters and genes with little similarity are placed in different clusters.

sections.heading: 2. RESEARCH MOTIVATION
sections.text: Soft set theory is a new mathematical tool for dealing with uncertainties that traditional mathematical tools cannot handle [2]. Previous cluster algorithms have not used soft set concepts and are only used to select characteristics and classify decision problems. In our proposed work, we applied the Fuzzy Soft set concept to the problem of gene clustering. The analytical goal is to find clusters of genes that are more similar to each other than observations in different clusters. This research area focuses on improving the performance of the approach to gene clustering. To analyze which cluster algorithm provides better results between different gene expression data sets, a comparative analysis is performed with the Kmeans and the Rough K-means algorithms.

sections.heading: 3. LITERATURE SURVEY
sections.text: Different approaches to gene filtering and different types of gene cluster methods are discussed in [3]. Data cluster analysis has been extensively applied to extract information from gene expression profiles obtained with DNA microarrays [4]. Cluster analysis technology is used to identify genes that are coordinated regulated. Many cluster techniques have been applied to gene expression data. For example, Limin Fu and Enzo Medico have introduced a novel fuzzy cluster method for analyzing DNA microarray data [5]. Jie Zhang, et al., have identified a number of genes that represent potential biomarkers for breast cancer prediction that patients can categorize into two groups with different predictions [6]. Author Daxin Jiang Chun Tang Aidong Zhang, gives extensive surveys for cluster analysis for S. gene expression algorithm [3].

sections.heading: 4. GENE SELECTION
sections.text: One of the interesting characteristics of microarray experiments is that they group information on a large number of genes. These questions will affect biologists in many ways, and we face many problems while focusing on convergence, so we have to choose the dimensionality reduction of gene expression data. One of the characteristics of gene expression data is that it makes sense to reduce the dimension in both genes and samples, but in our dissertation we only do the gene-based clustering, so we choose the pre-processing of gene expression data. Gene selection is also an interesting area of research among gene expression data [3]. Gene selection has three different approaches, such as filtering approach, wrapper approach, and embedded approach.

sections.heading: 4.1 Entropy filtering
sections.text: Entropy measures the uncertainty of a random variable. To measure the interdependence of two random genes X and Y, we used Shannon's information theory [15].H (X) = (1) H (X) is the entropy value of the individual gene X. Using the entropy filter, we calculated the information gain for the random genes and, depending on the random value, genes can be removed or selected [15].IG (X, Y) = H (X) + H (Y) -H (X, Y) (2)

sections.heading: 4.2 Procedure for Entropy based Gene Selection
sections.text: Step 1: Input expression matrix G = g1, g2,..., gn are the genes in the dataset. k = c1, c2,..., cn are the classes in the dataset. Step 2: Calculation of entropy for each class using Equation (1). Step 3: Calculation of the information gain for each gene using Equation (2). Step 4: Selection of genes (G) with the highest entropy value.

sections.heading: 5. CLUSTERING ALGORITHMS
sections.text: It is not the first time that the EU Commission has taken such a step.

sections.heading: 5.1 K-Means Clustering
sections.text: The K-mean algorithm [16] belongs to a group of algorithms called partitioning methods. It is one of the most widely used clustering techniques. It is a heuristic method in which each cluster is represented by the center of the cluster (i.e. the centroids). The K-mean algorithm is very simple and can be easily implemented in solving many problems. The K-mean algorithm is the most well-known square error-based cluster algorithm [16]. The K-mean algorithm is one of the benchmark algo rituals in partitional clustering. The goal of the K-mean cluster algorithm is usually to create a group of clusters that divide the data into similar groups. Samples close to each other are assumed to be similar, and the goal of the partitional cluster algorithms is to group data that is close together.

sections.heading: 5.2 Rough K-Means Clustering
sections.text: The Rough K-Means algorithm (Macqueen, 1967) belongs to the group of algorithms referred to as partitioning methods and which also have the most widely used cluster techniques. It is a heuristic method in which each cluster is represented by the center of the cluster. Rough clustering was useful in situations where clusters do not necessarily have sharp boundaries. The RoughK- Center algorithm provides a roughly defined theoretical touch over the traditional Grob Center algorithm to deal with uncertainties in cluster analysis [8]. Algorithm entry: data from n objects with d-characteristics, number of cluster k and parameter values. Flower, Wupper and Threshold. sections.heading: 5.3 Fuzzy Soft Rough K-Means Clustering
sections.text: The proposed Fuzzy Soft Rough K-Means algorithm is an extension of the Rough-K mean, but provides effective results compared to the Rough-Kmeans-based cluster approach [8].

sections.heading: 1. Pre-processing Phase
sections.text: Step 1: Selection of informative genes using entropy filtering approach. Remove low entropy genes. Step 2: Blurred vector values using S-shaped membership function or Z-shaped membership function.

sections.heading: 2. Clustering Phase

EXPERIMENTAL RESULTSTo evaluate the performance of gene expression of genes we have handled different gene scripts.

sections.heading: 6.1 Data set
sections.text: The data set comes from the broad institute database [17]. In the experimental analysis, gene expression data sets were taken from four different cancers, such as breast cancer, leukemia, lung cancer, and cancer. Table 1 shows the size of the original data sets and classes. After applying the entropy-based ranking technique for gene selection, the size of the original data set is reduced as shown in Table 2.

sections.heading: 6.2 Experimental Results of Gene Filtering
sections.text: In fact, most of them are able to survive themselves if they are not able to survive themselves, "he told the German Press Agency in an interview with" Welt am Sonntag ":" I don't think they will be able to save the world. "

sections.heading: 7. CONCLUSION
sections.text: A comparative analysis of the proposed work shows that the proposed cluster approach offers a higher battery race than the other two benchmark cluster algorithms. If the proposed cluster algorithm could integrate knowledge as partial as some cluster constraints in performing the cluster task, we can expect that the cluster results would be biologically more significant. One of the features of the gene expression data is that it makes sense to cluster both genes and samples, but in this work we have only performed the gene-based cluster approach. In the future, we will try to improve the performance of the cluster algorithm for both genes and samples.
